thread.title: Alcantara advances to quarters
thread.title_full: Alcantara advances to quarters | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: Alcantara advances to quarters
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 15, 2015 Francis Casey Alcantara bucked a sluggish start to pull off a 7-6 (1), 6-1 win over Taiwanese Liang Wen-Chun and book a quarterfinal seat in the Philippine Columbian Association (PCA) Open-Cebuana Lhuillier ITF Men’s Futures 2 at the PCA claycourt in Paco, Manila.
Alcantara, who made it to the main draw of the $15,000 tournament after getting a wildcard berth, teetered on the brink in the first set after falling behind, 5-2.
Francis Casey Alcantara makes a return during his 7-6 (1), 6-1 win over Taiwanese Liang Wen-Chun in the second round of the PCA Open-ITF Men’s Futures 2 at the PCA claycourt in Paco, Manila. (Bob Dungo Jr.)
But the country’s former top junior player recovered mightily and bewildered his rival with an assortment of heavy shots to gain full control of the match.
The Taiwanese was so disheartened by his first set meltdown that he slowly fell apart in the second set, making numerous errors which Alcantara took full advantage to win convincingly and keep the country’s title hope alive.
The win was likewise redemption of sort for Alcantara after his failure to reach the Round-of-8 in last week’s first ITF Futures tournament held at the Valle Verde in Pasig City.
The Cagayan de Oro native, however, will have to play a lot smarter and tougher when he plays top seed Enrique Lopez-Perez of Spain today.
The Spanish claimed the scalp of veteran Johnny Arcilla, 6-4, 6-3, to ease into the next round.
Meanwhile, Jeson Patrombon yielded to Indian Kunal Anand, 6-4, 6-4, and Fil-Spaniard Diego Dalisay succumbed to fourth seed Arata Onozawa of Japan, 6-1, 6-2, leaving Alcantara as the last Filipino standing in the tournament.
Meanwhile, unseeded Katsuki Nagao produced the biggest win for the day by stunning second seed Harry Bourchier of Australia, 6-3, 6-2.
Also moving into the next round were No. 8 Yu Cheng-Yu of Taiwan, a 6-3, 6-2 winner over Issei Okamura of Japan, and Leg 1 winner Makoto Ochi of Japan, who survived compatriot Kazuya Tamura, 6-7 (1), 7-6 (2), 6-1.
